div.p: SHANK, or Shank- Painter, in a ſhip, is a ſhort chain faſtened under the foremaſt-ſhrouds, by a bolt, to the ſhip’s ſides, having at the other end a rope faſtened to it. On this ſhank-painter the whole weight of the aft part of the anchor reſts, when it lies by the ſhip’s side. The rope, by which it is hauled up, is made fail about a timber-head.
Shank, in the manege, that part of a horſe’s fore leg which lies between the knee and the fetlock.
